intro: Byttneria muricata, commonly known as the rough-leafed byttneria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, rough-textured leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by water or animals.
